org.grouplens.grapht

Class InjectorBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.grouplens.grapht.AbstractContext
      • org.grouplens.grapht.InjectorBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Context

    public class InjectorBuilder
extends AbstractContext

    InjectorBuilder is a Builder implementation that is capable of creating a simple Injector. Additionally, it is root Context to make configuring the built Injector as easy as possible. Injectors created by InjectorBuilder instances memoize their created objects.

    Internally, it uses an BindingFunctionBuilder to accumulate bind rules and a DefaultInjector to resolve dependencies.

    Author:
    GroupLens Research

    • Constructor Detail

      • InjectorBuilder

        @Deprecated
public InjectorBuilder(Module... modules)
        Deprecated. use create(Module...) instead
        Create a new InjectorBuilder that automatically applies the given Modules via applyModule(Module). Additional Modules can be applied later as well. Configuration via the Context interface is also possible (and recommended if Modules aren't used) before calling build().
        Parameters:
        modules - Any modules to apply immediately

      • bind

        public <T> Binding<T> bind(Class<T> type)
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Start a new binding for the given type T within the scope of this context. The returned Binding instance can be configured and completed by invoking one of its various to() methods. Unless further configuration is done, this binding will match unqualified dependencies and dependencies with a qualifier annotated with AllowUnqualifiedMatch.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The matched source type
        Parameters:
        type - The raw class that is matched
        Returns:
        A new binding in this context for type T

      • bindAny

        public <T> Binding<T> bindAny(Class<T> type)
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Start a new binding for a type irrespective of qualifier. This is a shortcut for bind(type).withAnyQualifier().
        Specified by:
        bindAny in interface Context
        Overrides:
        bindAny in class AbstractContext
        Parameters:
        type - The type.
        Returns:
        A new binding in this context for type T with any (or no) qualifier.

      • within

        public Context within(Class<?> type)
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Create a new Context that extends the current context stack with the given class type. This matches with the default Qualifier. This is equivalent to within(null, type);
        Parameters:
        type - The type to extend this context by
        Returns:
        A new Context with a longer context stack

      • within

        public Context within(Class<? extends Annotation> qualifier,
             Class<?> type)
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Create a new Context that extends the current context stack with the given class and Qualifier annotation. If the qualifier is null, the default or null qualifier is used.
        Parameters:
        qualifier - The qualifier type that must be matched along with the type
        type - The type to extend this context by
        Returns:
        A new Context with a longer context stack

      • within

        public Context within(Annotation annot,
             Class<?> type)
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Create a new Context that extends the current context stack with the given class, qualified by the specific Annotation instance. If the qualifier is null, the default or null qualifier is used.

        The annotation provided must be serializable. Annotations built by AnnotationBuilder (recommended) or retrieved from the Java reflection API are serializable; if you use some other annotation implementation, it must be serializable.

        Parameters:
        annot - The qualifier instance that must be matched along with the type
        type - The type to extend this context by
        Returns:
        A new Context with a longer context stack

      • matching

        public Context matching(ContextPattern pattern)
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Restruct context to matching a particular pattern. The pattern is appended to the pattern generated by the other context-restriction methods. This is a high-powered method that won't be needed in most situations, but allows fine-grained control of context matching.
        Parameters:
        pattern - The context pattern to match.
        Returns:
        A context with longer context.

      • at

        public Context at(Class<?> type)
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Create a new Context that extends the current context stack with the given class type as an anchored match. This matches with the default Qualifier. This is equivalent to at(null, type);
        Parameters:
        type - The type to extend this context by
        Returns:
        A new Context with a longer context stack
        See Also:
        Context.at(Class, Class)

      • at

        public Context at(Class<? extends Annotation> qualifier,
         Class<?> type)
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Create a new Context that extends the current context stack with the given class and Qualifier annotation as an anchored match. If the qualifier is null, the default or null qualifier is used.

        Unlike Context.in(Class,Class), this match is anchored — that is, it only matches at the end of a context chain. Context is matched if it ends with this or, if further context is opened inside this context, if the inner context matches immediately.

        Parameters:
        qualifier - The qualifier type that must be matched along with the type
        type - The type to extend this context by
        Returns:
        A new Context with a longer context stack

      • at

        public Context at(Annotation annot,
         Class<?> type)
        Description copied from interface: Context
        Create a new Context that extends the current context stack with the given class, qualified by the specific Annotation instance. as an anchored match. If the qualifier is null, the default or null qualifier is used.

        The annotation provided must be serializable. Annotations built by AnnotationBuilder (recommended) or retrieved from the Java reflection API are serializable; if you use some other annotation implementation, it must be serializable.

        Parameters:
        annot - The qualifier instance that must be matched along with the type
        type - The type to extend this context by
        Returns:
        A new Context with a longer context stack
